benchmark_details.name: Is ‘Hope’ a Person or an Idea? A Pilot Benchmark for NER
benchmark_details.overview: This pilot study presents a small-scale but carefully annotated benchmark of Named Entity Recognition (NER) performance across six systems: three non-LLM NLP tools (NLTK, spaCy, Stanza) and three general-purpose large language models (LLMs: Gemini-1.5-flash, DeepSeek-V3, Qwen-3-4B).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate NER performance across traditional NLP tools and large language models on a small, ambiguity-rich dataset.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is small (119 tokens) and genre-specific, limiting statistical power and generalizability.

data.source: Manually selected and annotated sentences focusing on named entity recognition (NER) tasks.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by the author based on established NER conventions.

methodology.calculation: F1-score was computed for each entity type individually and subsequently macro-averaged.
methodology.interpretation: The F1-score is used as the primary evaluation metric due to its effectiveness in handling imbalanced datasets.
methodology.baseline_results: Results show that Gemini achieved the highest average F1-score.
methodology.validation: The performance of each system was evaluated against the human-annotated gold standard.
